title: Tropical Smoothie
text:
Tropical Smoothie





1 cup spinach
1 tsp ginger paste
1 banana
4-5 mint leaves
1 cup frozen mango
1 cup frozen pineapple





In a blender, combine 1 cup of water, spinach, ginger, banana, and mint until smooth.
Add mango and pineapple, and blend until smooth.
Serve in mason jars!

text:

title: Salmon Chowder
text:
Salmon Chowder





1 yellow onion
3 celery stalks
1 lb gold potatoes
4 oz mascarpone cheese
2 teaspoons white miso (can use tamari or soy sauce instead)
16 oz salmon
1/4 oz dill





Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch pieces. Finely chop the onion, celery, and dill.
In a stock pot, melt three tablespoons of butter and cook onions and celery for about five minutes.
Stir in 1 tablespoon of flour and cook 1-2 minutes, stirring frequently.
Continue stirring while slowly adding two cups of water.
Add potatoes, mascarpone, and miso.
Bring to a simmer over high heat, then lower to medium and cook for 15 minutes.
Remove skin from salmon and cut into bite-sized pieces. Stir salmon into the chowder and cook for 4-5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in chopped dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Pumpkin Toast (Serves 4)
text:
Pumpkin Toast





1/2 cup pumpkin
1/2 cup milk
2 eggs
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1 teaspoon vanilla
6-8 slices of bread





Mix pumpkin, milk, eggs, cinnamon, and vanilla in a medium bowl.
Dip a slice of bread, coat in pumpkin mixture, and cook in a generous amount of butter.
Repeat until pumpkin mixture runs out.
Serve with syrup, berries, and/or whipped cream.

title: Pasta and Peas (Serves 4)
text:
Pasta and Peas





1 large Vidalia onion
6 garlic cloves
12 oz bag of peas
1 pound regular or mezzi rigatoni
1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
Italian seasoning and chili flakes





Chop onion and mince garlic.
Boil and cook pasta according to package instructions, reserve 1 cup pasta water if it finishes before step 5.
Cook onion and garlic in 2 tablespoons olive oil until translucent, 5-7 minutes. Season with salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, and chili flakes.
Add frozen peas to onions and garlic.
Add two ladles of pasta water to onion, garlic, and peas and simmer.
Add drained pasta back into the stock pot, drizzle with olive oil, and season with Italian seasoning.
Mix onion, garlic, and peas into the stock pot with pasta. Mix in parmesan cheese.
Serve with additional parmesan cheese.

title: Overnight Oats
text:
Overnight Oats





1/4 tsp ground cinnamon
1/4 tsp ginger paste
2 tablespoons pine nuts
1 cups rolled oats
1 tablespoons maple syrup
4 teaspoons fig butter
1 plums
1 cups milk





Combine milk, cinnamon, and ginger, with a pinch of salt in a 1-pint wide mouthed mason jar.
Whisk oats and maple syrup. Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Thinly slice plums.
Split between two 1-pint wide mouthed mason jars. Top with fig butter, plums and pine nuts.

title: Latin Bowl (Serves 4)
text:
Latin Bowl





1 lb chicken thighs or extra firm tofu
10 oz bag of frozen corn
1 cup brown rice
1/2 cup quinoa
1 can of black beans
1/2 cup shredded cheddar jack or Mexican cheese
Cholula Cilantro Lime Cremosa Sauce
2 roma tomatoes
1 lime, quartered
0.5 oz fresh cilantro





Add brown rice and quinoa to 3 cups of salted water, bring to a boil, reduce to simmer for 15-20 minutes. When done, mix in lime zest, juice from one lime wedge, salt and pepper.
Dice roma tomatoes, zest and quarter lime, and roughly chop the fresh cilantro.
Season chicken/tofy with salt and pepper. Cook chicken/tofu, transfer to cutting board, and cut into bite size pieces.
Drain and rinse black beans.
Cook corn and beans together in a frying pan. If you choose to microwave the corn, you can add beans to the rice-quinoa mix when it is almost done.
Add rice-quinoa mix into each bowl. Top with chicken, corn, beans, cheese, tomato, cilantro lime cremosa sauce, fresh cilantro, and a lime wedge.

title: Kimchi Grilled Cheese
text:
Kimchi Grilled Cheese





1/8 tsp chili flakes
4 garlic cloves
5 oz spinach
1 tsp gochujang
3 tsp mayonnaise
2/3 cup kimchi
4 slices of bread
2/3 cup cheddar cheese
4 tablespoons everything seasoning.





In a frying pan, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil with chili flakes.
Add spinach and cook until wilted.
Mix gochujang and mayonnaise in a small bowl and spread on one side of each slice of bread. Sprinkle with everything seasoning and press it into the bread.
Build sandwiches by layering spinach, kimchi, and cheese between two slices of bread.
Fry in butter until golden brown on both sides.

title: Garden Tomato Quiche (Serves 6-8)
text:
Garden Tomato Quiche





1 egg
2 1/2 tablespoons ice water
1 1/2 cups flour
10 tablespoons butter
7 eggs
1/2 cups parmesan cheese
1 cup swiss and gruyere shredded cheese blend
1 cup milk
1 teaspoon italian seasoning
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon chili flakes
1 tsp dried basil (or 4-5 fresh basil leaves)
12 ounces cherry tomatoes





Grease a pie plate.
Whisk egg and ice water in a small bowl.
Cut butter into small cubes and mix into flour and salt. If you have a food processor, use it. Otherwise mix with a fork until it is a sand-like mixture.
Add the egg mixture into the bowl with the flour and mix until a dough forms.
Roll out dough to fit a pie plate, pierce with a fork, and press it into the pan.
Put the pie plate in the freezer while the oven preheats to 375 degrees.
Blind bake quiche crust with pie weights (can use dried beans instead) for 15 minutes.
Mix 3 egg yolks, 4 whole eggs, parmesan cheese, shredded cheese, milk, italian seasoning, salt, chili flakes, and basil.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Pour egg mixture into the pie plate.
Place cherry tomatoes cut-side up, filling the surface area of the quiche. Sprinkle with salt and italian seasoning.
Bake for 35-50 minutes, until the edges are set but the center has a slight jiggle or it reaches an internal temperature near 175.

title: Enchiladas
text:
Enchiladas





2 green onions
1 large poblano
2 roma tomatoes
1 can of black beans
1 tablespoon southwest spice
6-8 flour tortillas
1 jar of salsa verde
4 oz monterey jack cheese
2 tablespoons sour cream





Dice tomato and poblano. Thinly slice green onions, separating greens and whites. Drain (save liquid) and rinse black beans.
Cook poblano in oil over medium heat until softened (5-7 minutes).
Add almost all of the southwest seasoning (except a half tsp), tomato, green onion whites, half the black beans, and 1/8 cup black bean liquid. Cook another 5-10 minutes, until peppers are tender.
Add remanining beans and a drizzle of oil in a small sauce pan over medium heat.
Add 1/4 cup black bean liquid and bring to a simmer. 6. Add 1 tablespoon of butter and cook until melted.
Using a silicone masher, the black beans and butter until smooth.
Spread black bean mixture over tortillas and evenly split filling between tortillas. Roll up tortillas and place them in a 9 x 13 baking dish.
Top with salsa verde and monterey jack cheese. Bake at 450 for 5-10 minutes until cheese melts and starts to brown.
Combine sour cream and 1/2 tsp southwest seasoning. Mix in 1 teaspoon of water at a time until sauce can be drizzled. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve enchiladas with sauce and green onion greens.

title: Chia Parfait
text:
Chia Parfait





1/3 cup chia seeds
1 tablespoon maple syrup
1 cup almond milk
1 cup of vanilla yogurt
2 tablespoons apricot jam
6 dried apricots
1/4 cup pumpkin seeds





Combine chia seeds, syrup, and milk with a pinch of salt in a 1-pint wide mouthed mason jar.
Whisk cover and refrigerate overnight.
Dice dried apricots.
Split between two 1-pint wide mouthed mason jars. Top with yogurt, apricot jam, dried apricots, and pumpkin seeds.

title: Burgers with pasta salad
text:
Burgers





1 pound 80/20 ground beef
4 brioche buns
4 slices of cheddar cheese
pickle chips
1 tomato
1 red onion
shredded lettuce
1 pound pasta (rigatoni or penne)
1 cup mayonnaise
1 can black olives
1 white onion





Boil pasta according to package instructions. Place in a large bowl and cool to room temperature.
Dice onion and drain olives.
Combine pasta, onion, olives and mayonnaise. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Refrigerate over night.
Thinly slice the tomato and red onion.
Mix ground beef with salt and pepper.
Create 4 evenly-sized patties. Put a dimple in the middle so it cooks to a consistent thickness.
Lightly toast the bun.
Build the burger by layering the burger, sliced tomato, onion, and pickles. Add ketchup, mustard, and mayonnaise to taste.

title: Breakfast Cheesecake
text:
Breakfast Cheesecake





6 Stella D’oro breakfast treats
1/3 cup sugar
1/3 cup butter (melted)
3 5.3 oz vanilla yogurt cups
1 cup cream cheese (not whipped)
2 eggs
2/3 cup sugar
1/4 cup flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 heaping teaspoon vanilla bean paste
Various fresh berries, cut into bite-size pieces





Place Stella D’oro cookies into a Ziploc bag and pulverize.
Combine cookie dust, sugar, and melted butter and combine.
Push the crust into the bottom of an 8 or 9 inch springform pan.
Preheat oven to 325F.
Mix the vanilla yogurt cups, cream cheese, eggs, sugar, flour, salt, vanilla bean paste together until smooth. A blender works best, but a hand mixer can work.
Pour yogurt mixture on top of the crust in the springform pan.
Bake for 55 minutes. Cook a few more minutes if the middle is not yet set.
Cool on the counter for about two hours, and then overnight in the refrigerator.
Top with berries and serve.

title: Sausage and Gravy (Serves 4)
text:
Biscuits and Gravy





1 lb sausage
1/4 cup flour
2.5 cups of milk
1 can of biscuits
Optional: eggs





Cook biscuits according to package instructions.
Cook sausage in a stock pot.
Once sausage is cooked add 1/4 cup flour and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add milk 1/2 cup at a time, stirring frequently.
Season with a lot of pepper.
Top biscuits with sausage gravy and eggs (optional).

title: Berry Melon Smoothie
text:
Berry Melon Smoothie





1/2 cup cranberry juice
1 cup spinach
1/2 tsp ginger paste
2 clementines
1/3 cup watermelon
1.5 cups of some combination of blueberry, blueberry, blackberry, and strawberries
1 tsp of honey





In a blender, combine 1/2 cup of water, cranberry juice, spinach, ginger, and clementines until smooth.
Add watermelon and berries, and blend until smooth.
Serve in mason jars!

Serve in mason jars!

title: Baked Ziti
text:
Baked Ziti





1 2 oz can of anchovies
1 vidalia onion
5 garlic cloves
1/2 cup red wine (optional)
1 small can of tomato paste
2 tablespoons butter
1 large can of peeled tomatoes
2 tablespoons honey
3 tsp italian seasoning
1/8 tsp red pepper flakes
1 pound pasta (e.g., rigatoni or penne)
1 pound of ground beef or sausage
1 large container of ricotta cheese
1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
1 egg
8 oz mozzarella





Dice onion and mince garlic.
Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a sauce pan. Add anchovies and cook until they break down.
Add onions and garlic to the pan and cook until soft.
Add red wine and simmer for 3-5 minutes (optional).
Add tomato paste and butter, and cook until fully combined.
At peeled tomatoes, stir breaking up tomatoes.
Once simmering, add honey, 2 tsp italian seasoning, pepper flakes and continue to stir.
Brown meat in a frying pan with 1 tsp italian seasoning.
Prepare pasta according to package instructions. Save 1 cup of pasta water in case you need to loosen the sauce.
Drain meat and put in a large bowl. Mix in ricotta, egg, half the mozzarella, half the parmesan, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Add in half the tomato sauce and all of the pasta.
Add mixture to a 9x13 glass pan. Top with remaining tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and parmesan.
Bake in the oven at 375 degrees for 35 minutes.

title: The Best Way to Eat Arugula (Serves 4)
text:
Arugula Pasta





1 bag baby arugula (regular is fine, too)
1 pound pasta (e.g., bucatini or farfalle)
6-8 ounces of fresh or jarred pesto
1 lemon
Grated parmesan cheese
Pine nuts





Boil and cook pasta according to box, strain but reserve 1 cup pasta water.
In the stock pot used to cook the pasta, add two tablespoons of olive oil and whisk in pesto over medium heat.
Whisk in 1/2 cup pasta water, a little more if needed to create a light sauce.
Remove sauce from heat and toss cooked pasta in the sauce.
Stir arugula in and cover until wilted.
Add juice from half a lemon, add more to taste.
Serve with parmesan cheese and pine nuts.

title: African Peanut Soup (Serves 4)
text:
African Peanut Soup





2 large sweet potato, peeled and cubed
1 large sweet onion, chopped
1 large red bell pepper, diced
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 jalapeno pepper, minced
1 lb chicken thighs or extra firm tofu
1 c medium salsa
32 oz chicken broth
1 can of black beans
1/3 cup creamy peanut butter





Season chicken/tofu with salt and pepper. Cook chicken/tofu, transfer to cutting board, and cut into bite size pieces.
Saute potato, onion, red pepper, garlic and jalapeno about 10 minutes in small amount of olive oil.
Stir in cooked chicken/tofu, salsa, broth and beans. Simmer for at least 10 minutes.
Remove 1 ladle of broth, add peanut butter and mix in small bowl until dissolved. Add peanut butter mixture to soup.

title: Alfredo Pasta (Serves 4)
text:
Alfredo





1 pound pasta (e.g., fettuccine or bucatini)
1 pound chicken breast.
6 tablespoons butter
4 garlic cloves
1.5 cups heavy cream
3/4 cup parmesan cheese
1 zucchini
1 shallot





Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Season chicken with olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Cook on rimmed baking sheet until cooked 15-25 minutes.
Mince garlic, cut zucchini into half moons, and dice shallot.
Melt butter in a large frying pan. Add garlic, cook until just starting to brown (1-2 minutes).
Add zucchini to the pan and cook until tender.
Add heavy cream to pan and simmer for about ten minutes.
Add in parmesan cheese and stir until smooth. Remove from heat.
When ready, boil pasta according to package instructions. Save a cup of pasta water.
Mix pasta and sauce. If needed, add pasta water to loosen the sauce.
Serve with grated Parmesan.

title: Alfredo Pasta (Serves 4)
text:
1 pound pasta (e.g., fettuccine or bucatini)
1 pound chicken breast.
6 tablespoons butter
4 garlic cloves
1.5 cups heavy cream
3/4 cup parmesan cheese
1 zucchini
1 shallot

title: Alfredo Pasta (Serves 4)
text:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Season chicken with olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Cook on rimmed baking sheet until cooked 15-25 minutes.
Mince garlic, cut zucchini into half moons, and dice shallot.
Melt butter in a large frying pan. Add garlic, cook until just starting to brown (1-2 minutes).
Add zucchini to the pan and cook until tender.
Add heavy cream to pan and simmer for about ten minutes.
Add in parmesan cheese and stir until smooth. Remove from heat.
When ready, boil pasta according to package instructions. Save a cup of pasta water.
Mix pasta and sauce. If needed, add pasta water to loosen the sauce.
Serve with grated Parmesan.

title: Autumn Grain Bowl (Serves 2)
text:
Autumn Grain Bowl





1/2 cup quinoa
1 delicata squash
1 package of baby broccoli or broccolini
2 tablespoons tahini
1 tablespoon maple syrup
1/2 teaspoon apple cider vinegar
1/8 cup craisins
1/8 cup pumpkin seeds
1/2 teaspoon ginger
3/4 teaspoon paprika
pinch of cayenne
pinch of cinnamon, nutmeg, or clove
olive oil
salt and paper





Preheat oven to 425F.
Cut squash in half lengthwise and dig out seeds. Cut cleaned squash in half moons about 1/2 inches thick. Place half moons in a bowl with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, ginger, paprika, cayenne, cinnamon, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to spread seasoning and then place on 1/2 of an oiled baking sheet.
Cut broccoli into single stems. Place on the other half of the oiled baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil and add salt and pepper.
Put baking sheet in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
Combine 1 cup of water with quinoa and some salt. Bring to a boil, lower heat, cover, and cook until water absorbs.
Take baking sheet out of oven, flip squash and bake 5 more minutes.
Mix tahini, maple syrup, vinegar, 1 tablespoon of water.
Top quinoa with broccoli and squash. Sprinkle craisins and pumpkin seeds on top, and drizzle with tahini sauce.

title: Autumn Grain Bowl (Serves 2)
text:

1 delicata squash
1 package of baby broccoli or broccolini

1/2 teaspoon ginger
3/4 teaspoon paprika

title: BBQ Chili
text:
BBQ Chili





2 cans of baked beans
1 can of black beans (drained and rinsed)
1 can of white kidney beans (drained and rinsed)
1 can of red kidney beans (drained and rinsed)
1 large yellow onion
1 pound of ground beef
1 pound of bacon
16 ounces of BBQ sauce





Dice the yellow onion.
Drain and rinse black, white, and red beans.
Crumble and cook beef in a frying pan.
Cook bacon and cut into bite size pieces.
Combine all ingredients in a crock pot. Cook at low heat for 6-7 hours. Stir occasionally.

title: BBQ Chili
text:

1 can of black beans (drained and rinsed)
1 can of white kidney beans (drained and rinsed)

Combine all ingredients in a crock pot. Cook at low heat for 6-7 hours. Stir occasionally.

title: Bibimbap (Serves 4)
text:
Bibimbap





1 cup rice
8 oz mushrooms
3 garlic cloves
8 oz sugar snap peas
2 tsp gochujang
2 tablespoon mayonnaise
3 tsp sesame oil
5 oz spinach
4 eggs
1 cup kimchi





Cook 1/2 cup rice according to package instructions.
Thinly slice mushrooms, mince garlic. Trim stem ends and strings from snap peas.
Combine garlic, gochujang, 1 tsp sesame oil, and mayonnaise. Mix in water 1 tsp at a time until sauce can be drizzled.
Cook mushrooms in a bit of oil until lightly browned.
Add sugar snap peas and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add spinach and cook until wilted.
Add 2 tsp sesame oil and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Fry 4 eggs.
Divide rice, kimchi, stirfried vegetables, and eggs between bowls. Drizzle with gochujang sauce.

title: Bibimbap (Serves 4)

title: BLT Salad (Serves 4)
text:
BLT Salad





1 pound tri-color spiral pasta
16-oz pre-cut crisp lettuce (e.g., romaine, baby butter leaf)
12 ounces grape tomatoes
1.5 cups shredded cheddar cheese
1 pound of thick cut bacon
1 jar of ranch dressing





Prepare pasta according to package instructions.
Cook bacon to be crispy.
Refrigerate pasta and bacon until cold.
Halve tomatoes and dice cooked bacon.
Add lettuce, tomato, cheese, bacon, and dressing to taste in a bowl and toss.

title: Breakfast Muffins
text:
Breakfast Muffins





1.5 cups flour
0.75 cups sugar
2 tsp baking powder
1/4 tsp salt
1/3 cup avocado oil
1 large egg
1/3 cup milk
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 cup blueberries (any berry can work)





Preheat oven to 400 degrees and grease muffin pan.
Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.
Whisk avocado oil, egg, milk, and vanilla in a medium bowl.
Mix the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and then gently stir in the berries.
Divide the batter between muffin cups and bake 15-20 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 207 or a toothpick comes out clean.

title: Caprese Sandwiches
text:
Caprese Sandwiches





1 tomato
8 oz fresh mozzarella
2 croissants or brioche buns
1 small jar of pesto





Slice tomato and mozzarella, and cut croissants or buns.
Spread croissants or buns with pesto.
Layer tomato and mozzarella.
Fry sandwiches in butter until toasted.

title: Caprese Sandwiches
text:

8 oz fresh mozzarella
2 croissants or brioche buns
1 small jar of pesto

text:

Spread croissants or buns with pesto.

Fry sandwiches in butter until toasted.

title: Eggplant Parmesan
text:
Eggplant Parmesan





1 eggplant
4 garlic cloves
4 ounces shredded mozzarella cheese
1/4 cup panko breadcrumbs
1 shallot
2 tsp Italian seasoning
1 can of fire roasted diced tomatoes
1 cup couscous
1 lemon
1 0.25 oz package of fresh basil





Cut ends off eggplant, peel, and slice eggplant lengthwise into 4 slices. Mince garlic and shallot. Zest lemon, cut into wedges adn juice half of them. Roughly chop basil.
Coat eggplant in olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook in an oven at 425 degrees for 20 minutes, flipping halfway.
Mix half the garlic, and the mozzarella, breadcrumbs and 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Cook remaining garlic, shallot in olive oil. Add Italian seasoning and cook until fragrant.
Add tomatoes, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Simmer until thickened, about 10 minutes.
Cook couscous according to package instructions. Remove from heat and stir in lemon zest and juice, half the basil, and a tablespoon of olive oil.
Top eggplant with tomato sauce and breadcrumbs, and cook an additional 5-10 minutes.
Serve topped with remaining basil and lemon.

title: Eggplant Parmesan
text:
1 eggplant
4 garlic cloves
4 ounces shredded mozzarella cheese
1/4 cup panko breadcrumbs
1 shallot

1 can of fire roasted diced tomatoes
1 cup couscous
1 lemon
1 0.25 oz package of fresh basil

title: Florida Rolls (Serves 2)
text:
Florida Rolls





1 can hearts of palm
4 garlic cloves
1 shallot
1 celery stalk
1/4 ounce fresh dill
1 lemon
1/4 cup mayonnaise
1 tablespoon capers
2 brioche buns
1 tsp old bay seasoning





Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Mince garlic, shallot, and dill. Thinly slice celery. Cut lemon into wedges, juice half of them.
Combine hearts of palm with a drizzle of olive oil, 1 tsp old bay seasoning, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Cook hearts of palm on a rimmed baking sheet for 20 minutes.
Combine shallot, celery, dill, mayonnaise, and capers in a medium bowl.
Add cooked hearts of palm to bowl with shallot mixture.
Toast buns and top with hearts of palm.
Serve with lemon wedges.

title: Florida Rolls (Serves 2)

title: RecipesWebsite
text:
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: Lasagna
text:
Lasagna





1 2 oz can of anchovies
1 vidalia onion
5 garlic cloves
1/2 cup red wine (optional)
1 small can of tomato paste
2 tablespoons butter
1 large can of peeled tomatoes
2 tablespoons honey
4 tsp italian seasoning
1/8 tsp red pepper flakes
1 batch of fresh lasanga noodles (or 1 box of lasanga noodles)
1 large container of ricotta cheese
1 cup grated parmesan cheese
1 egg
8 oz mozzarella





Dice onion and mince garlic.
Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a sauce pan. Add anchovies and cook until they break down.
Add onions and garlic to the pan and cook until soft.
Add red wine and simmer for 3-5 minutes (optional).
Add tomato paste and butter, and cook until fully combined.
At peeled tomatoes, stir breaking up tomatoes.
Once simmering, add honey, 2 tsp italian seasoning, pepper flakes and continue to stir.
Prepare pasta noodles.
In a medium bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, mozzarella, parmesan, 2 tsp italian seasoning, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Spread one cup of sauce on the bottom of the casserole dish. Add a layer of lasagna noodles. Spread 1/3 of the cheese mixture. Repeat two more times.
Top with mozzarela cheese.
Cover with tin foil and bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove tin foil and bake uncooked another 15-20 minutes, until cheese is melted and browning.

title: Lasagna
text:
1 2 oz can of anchovies
1 vidalia onion
5 garlic cloves
1/2 cup red wine (optional)
1 small can of tomato paste
2 tablespoons butter
1 large can of peeled tomatoes
2 tablespoons honey
4 tsp italian seasoning
1/8 tsp red pepper flakes
1 batch of fresh lasanga noodles (or 1 box of lasanga noodles)

title: Meatloaf and Baked Carrots
text:
Meatloaf and Baked Carrots





6 garlic cloves
2 teaspoon ginger paste
1 shallot
16 oz turkey
1 egg
1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs
4 medium-to-large carrots
1/4 cup General Tso’s or Hoisin Sauce





Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Chop shallot and mince garlic.
In a small bowl, mix carrots, 2 tablespoons olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste.
In a medium bowl, mix turkey, ginger, two-thirds of the garlic, shallot, egg, panko breadcrumbs, a teaspoon of salt, and a pinch of pepper.
Form four mini meatloafs using the turkey mixture and generously brush with sauce.
Bake meatloaf and carrots on a rimmed baking sheet for 20 minutes. Sprinkle remaining garlic on carrots and let sit for 2-3 minutes.

title: Meatloaf and Baked Carrots
text:
6 garlic cloves
2 teaspoon ginger paste
1 shallot
16 oz turkey
1 egg
1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs
4 medium-to-large carrots
1/4 cup General Tso’s or Hoisin Sauce

title: Meatloaf and Baked Carrots
text:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Chop shallot and mince garlic.
In a small bowl, mix carrots, 2 tablespoons olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste.
In a medium bowl, mix turkey, ginger, two-thirds of the garlic, shallot, egg, panko breadcrumbs, a teaspoon of salt, and a pinch of pepper.
Form four mini meatloafs using the turkey mixture and generously brush with sauce.
Bake meatloaf and carrots on a rimmed baking sheet for 20 minutes. Sprinkle remaining garlic on carrots and let sit for 2-3 minutes.

title: Pad Thai
text:
Pad Thai





14 oz Thai stir fry noodles
2 limes
2 tablespoons tamari (or regular soy sauce)
1/4 cup sweet and sour sauce
2 bell peppers
4 garlic cloves
1 package extra-firm tofu
1/4 cup roasted peanuts
2 eggs





Boil Thai noodles according to package instructions. Rince under cold water and coat with oil.
Drain tofu, cut into bite-sized pieces, and season with salt and pepper.
Thinly slice peppers, mince garlic, chop peanuts.
Squeeze 2 tablespoons lime juice into a small bowl. Mix in tamari and sweet and sour sauce.
Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Cook tofu until golden brown (5-10 minutes). Move to a paper towel lined plate.
In the same pan, add oil and cook bell peppers until tender. Add to the plate with the tofu.
In the same pan, add oil and garlic. Cook 1-2 minutes until browned.
Add noodles and sauce and cook about 3-5 minutes, until noodles absorb some sauce.
Move noodles to one side of the pan. Add a little oil and two eggs. Scramble the eggs until almost set, then stir them into the noodles.
Mix in tofu, peppers, and peanuts.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with lime wedges.

title: Pad Thai
text:

2 limes

1/4 cup sweet and sour sauce

Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with lime wedges.

title: Pizza
text:
PizzaPizza





12 oz baby broccoli
8 oz mozzarella
1/4 cup parmesan
2 cups flour + up to 1/2 cup
1 packet instant yeast
1.5 tsp sugar
1 tsp salt
2 tablespoons olive oil
3/4 cup warm water





Drizzle baby broccoli with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Bake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutes until bright green and tender.
Mix 1 cup flour, instant yeast, sugar, and salt in a large bowl.
Stir in olive oil and warm water. Ensure water is 100-105 degrees.
Stir in 1 cup of flour and work into a dough. Add more flour if needed.
Oil the sides of a medium bowl and and add pasta dough. Cover and set aside until it doubles in size (20-40 minutes).
On a lightly floured surface, knead dough until smooth.
Roll out into a circle, and place it on an oiled cookie sheet.
Drizzle olive oil over the pizza dough. Then top with sauce, broccoli, and cheese.
Cook on bottom shelf of the oven for 15-20 minutes.

title: Pizza
text:

8 oz mozzarella
1/4 cup parmesan

title: Red Wine Ragu (Serves 4)
text:
Red Wine Ragu





1 pound pasta (e.g., farfalle or rigatoni)
1.5 pounds of stew beef
2 bottles of red wine
1 vidalia onion
1-2 celery sticks
1-2 carrots
4 garlic cloves
4 oz diced pancetta
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon ground clove (or 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg)
1 square dark chocolate
1/2 teaspoon dried sage (or 2-3 fresh sage leaves chopped)
1 teaspoon dried rosemary (or one fresh rosemary sprig)
Parmesan cheese to top





The night before, place stew beef in a bowl with pepper and enough red wine to cover. Marinate in the refrigerator overnight.
Dice onion, carrot, and celery. Mince garlic, and sage and rosemary if using fresh. Finely shave dark chocolate with a knife.
Add pancetta to a stock pan with olive oil. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add onion, carrot, celery and garlic to stock pan and cook until vegetables are cooked.
Drain beef marinade.
Add beef, sage, rosemary, chocolate, cinnamon, and clove to the sauce pan. Stir.
Cover with red wine, add a pinch of salt and pepper, and simmer for about two hours.
When ready, boil pasta according to package instructions. Save a cup of pasta water.
Add pasta to stock pan with sauce and stir. If needed, add pasta water to loosen the sauce.
Serve with grated Parmesan.

title: Red Wine Ragu (Serves 4)
text:
1 pound pasta (e.g., farfalle or rigatoni)
1.5 pounds of stew beef
2 bottles of red wine
1 vidalia onion

4 oz diced pancetta

1/4 teaspoon ground clove (or 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg)

1/2 teaspoon dried sage (or 2-3 fresh sage leaves chopped)
1 teaspoon dried rosemary (or one fresh rosemary sprig)
Parmesan cheese to top

When ready, boil pasta according to package instructions. Save a cup of pasta water.
Add pasta to stock pan with sauce and stir. If needed, add pasta water to loosen the sauce.
Serve with grated Parmesan.

title: Shakshuka
text:
Shakshuka





1 yellow onion
4 cloves of garlic
1 red pepper
1 14.5oz can crushed fire-roasted tomatoes
1/4 oz cilantro
4 eggs
feta cheese
pitas or naan





Chop onion and red pepper. Mince garlic.
In a frying pan, heat one tablespoon of oil over medium heat and cook onions for about five minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes and cook until boiling. Reduce heat and simmer another 5-10 minutes, until the sauce is thickened.
Using the back of a spoon, make four indentations in the sauce. Crack an egg in each indentation. Cook seven minutes longer until eggs are just set.
Remove from heat, and sprinkle feta and cilantro.
Serve in a bowl with toasted pitas or naan.

text:

4 cloves of garlic
1 red pepper

pitas or naan
